PASSENGER TARIFF, INFORMATION AND REGULATIONS

ONE WAY TICKETS: One Way tickets to Bermuda may only

CABLE AND RADIO ADDRESSES: Pan American Airways
-"PANAIR"; Imperial Airways (Bermuda) Ltd.— "AIRWAYS".
AIR/SEA INTERCHANGE: Arrangements with the Furness
Bermuda Line are being made to permit passengers to fly one way
and return by sea, or vice versa.
Round trip fares will be the com-
bination of half the round trip sea and air fares, according to the
accommodations used.
Should one decide to fly or take the steamer
on the return, contrary to original arrangements, unused portions
of tickets will be accepted by the carrying line for application to
the return ticket (sea or air). Any difference will be collected or
refunded.
The exchange will be subject to the Carriers' regulations.
SCHEDULES AND TARIFFS: Schedules and tariffs are sub-
ject to change without notice.
None of the Carriers
guarantee
punctuality in maintaining schedules shown in public Timetables.
RESERVATIONS: Fare must be paid immediately upon con-
firmation of the fact that the space to be reserved is available, and
unless so paid the reservation will not be held. Ticket flight coupons
will not be validated for passage unless reservation of accommoda-
tion has been previously
effected and proper fare paid. Return
reservation should be made if possible when securing outward ac-
commodation.
PASSPORTS AND VISAS: No passports or visas required
for entry into Bermuda.
On departure from the United States, all
persons, other than U. S. citizens and Canadians in transit through
the United States, require sailing permits.
Aliens who have previ-
ously been admitted legally into
the
United States,
who
depart
therefrom, to visit Bermuda and who return to the United States
within six months, shall not be required to submit Immigration
Visas or permits to reenter; but shall be required to submit proof
of legal admittance
before being allowed to embark.
Such aliens
Immigration Visas or permits to reenter the United States.
Femining on Bermuda over six monte she hered stad to pre pert
sons not permanent residents of Bermuda, or Bermuda-born, may
remain on the Island not longer than eight months.
Other entry
requirements of the United States and Bermuda will be observed.
ROUND TRIP TICKETS:
Will be valid for transportation
for four months from date of initial departure unless extended by
special arrangement. Round trip air tickets at the published round
trip fare must be purchased in advance in order to obtain the round
trip fare reduction.
CHILDREN'S FARES: A child in arms under two years of
age will be carried free when accompanied by parent or guardian
and provided parent or guardian has paid effective fare. A child 2
years of age or over, but under 12, may travel at half of the stand-
ard adult fare and may occupy a seat.
BAGGAGE ALLOWANCE: Adult tickets include a free allow-
ance of 20 kilos (44 lbs.) of hand baggage aboard planes. Baggage
in excess of this allowance will be carried only when the capacity
of aircraft permits and when excess charges shall have been paid.
Children traveling on half fare tickets will receive one-half the free
allowance for adults. Children under two years of age will receive
no free allowance.
TRUNKS: Shipment of trunks will be arranged via steamer, as
a courtesy to air passengers. Those traveling both ways by air will
be charged the steamship lines' excess baggage rates.
Those using
both air and steamer services for round trip may ship their baggage
unaccompanied via steamer at one half of the steamship excess rates.
PROHIBITED FROM CARRIAGE: Transportation of the
following will not be permitted: (a) Things or persons the carriage
of which is contrary to the laws of any state or country to be flown
from, to or over; (b) Things or persons which are liable to en-
danger aircraft, passengers or cargo, or which may cause annoyance
to other passengers, or which may not be suitable for transportaion
by aircraft; and (c) Livestock, except by special arrangement.
EMBARKATION NOTICE: Passengers must arrive at the
airport sufficiently in advance of the scheduled departure of aircraft
to permit the completion of governmental and other formalities and
the checking of baggage. Departures will not be delayed for passen-
gers who arrive at airports too late to enable these formalities to be
completed before scheduled departure time.
